intro: Paronychia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican nailweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of pink to purple, are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Paronychia mexicana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
